intro: Nigella involucrata, commonly known as love-in-a-mist, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. Its seeds, which are small and black, are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. Nigella involucrata is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic properties.
